caption.p: Forty-eight highest burden counties, Washington DC, and San Juan, Puerto Rico, that accounted for more than 50% of new human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) diagnoses during 2016 and 2017 are shown in purple. Seven states with substantial rural burdens of HIV are shown in blue. Adapted from Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Ending the HIV epidemic. Available at: https://www.cdc.gov/endhiv/index.html. Accessed 17 July 2020.
